messageBody:
Hi all,

I remember some one asking if we can pass arguments from command line to a
JUnit test

I have given it some serious thought and I doesn't take long to realize the
flexibility it can provide to JUnit.

I am sending my suggestion of how we can implement it.

For example, let my JUnit test case be mypackage.MyTest

We run the test using java command with command line arghuments as follows:

java mypackage.MyTest arguments

In order for arguments to be accessible in side MyTest, I suggest we make
following changes in JUnit API.

The setUp() currently accepts no arguments and is heavily used to create the
test environment. If we change its signature as follows (somewhat similar to
main() ),

public void setUp( String[] args )

Please note that the first element of args[] should have value "arguments"
and not mypackage.MyTest followed by "arguments"

This will give a lot of flexibility to a JUnit test.

Thanks

Vishal
